Header.comment: This is an automatically generated file. Do not edit.

variable.description: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

abs550aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols at wavelength 550 nanometers.
abs550aer_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Ambient Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm

bldep_tmax-u-hxy-u.description: maximum boundary layer height during the day (add cell\_methods attribute: "time: maximum")

bldep_tmin-u-hxy-u.description: minimum boundary layer height during the day (add cell\_methods attribute: "time: minimum")

cOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots

cProductLut_tpt-u-hxy-multi.description: Anthropogenic pools associated with land use tiles into which harvests and cleared carbon are deposited before release into atmosphere PLUS any remaining anthropogenic pools that may be associated with lands which were converted into land use tiles during reported period. Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).
cProductLut_tpt-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles

cProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.
cProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change

cSoilLut_tpt-u-hxy-multi.description: end of year values (not annual mean)
cSoilLut_tpt-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles

cSoilPools_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated
cSoilPools_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)

cSoil_tavg-d100cm-hxy-lnd.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
cSoil_tavg-d100cm-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth

cSoil_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.description: for models with vertically discretised soil carbon, report total soil carbon for each level
cSoil_tavg-sl-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Level (Summed over All Soil Carbon Pools in That Level)

cSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.
cSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool

cVegLut_tpt-u-hxy-multi.description: end of year values (not annual mean)
cVegLut_tpt-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Carbon in Vegetation on Land-Use Tiles

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-ng.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-ng.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-shb.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-shb.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-tree.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-tree.ui-label: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Tree Tiles

clwvi_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvic_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clwvimodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

cly_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2\*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields
cly_tavg-p39-hy-air.ui-label: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio

co2_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: As co2, but only at the surface

co2_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2_tclm-p19-hxy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co2_tclm-u-hm-u.description: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

co2mass_tavg-u-hm-u.description: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

co3_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

co3_tavg-op20bar-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

co3satarag_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
co3satarag_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water

co3satarag_tavg-op20bar-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.
co3satarag_tavg-op20bar-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water

co_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

co_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: This is the daily mean for CO volume mixing ratio in lowest model layer

cod_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical\_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation\_wavelength or radiation\_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

conccn_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: This is the number concentration of air particles in air

conccn_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The variable represents the instantaneous Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
conccn_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Sub-daily Aerosol Number Concentration at CF sites

cropFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

cropFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

cropFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

depdust_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

depthl_ti-u-hxy-u.description: Depth of lakes, if this quantity is present in the model. If computed via volume and area, then this is lake volume divided by lake area.
depthl_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Depth of Lake Below the Surface

deptho_ti-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean bathymetry. Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.

depthsl_ti-u-hxy-u.description: Total (cumulative) thickness of all soil layers. This is the sum of individual thicknesses of all soil layers.
depthsl_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total (Cumulative) Thickness of All Soil Layers

detoc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

dfe_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

dfe_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: dissolved iron in sea water is meant to include both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not, e.g., particulate detrital iron)

difmxybo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

difmxylo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

diftrblo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the "thickness" diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called "ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity".  The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.
diftrblo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection

diftrelo_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.

difvho_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.

difvso_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.

dispkexyfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
dispkexyfo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction

dissi14cabio_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration

dissoc_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

dmc_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

dms_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

dmso_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water in the near surface layer
dmso_tavg-d0m-hxy-sea.ui-label: Surface Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water

dmso_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water
dmso_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water

do3chm_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Net chemical production of ozone in the atmosphere

dpco2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.

dpo2_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

drybc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
drybc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Dry Deposition Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

dryh2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via its soil sink due to bacterial consumption.
dryh2_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere via soil sink

dryhno3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the loss of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to dry deposition

drynh3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Monthly Dry Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface

dryno3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Loss rate of nitrate (NO3) aerosol from the atmosphere due to dry deposition

drynoy_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NOy at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.
drynoy_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Daily Dry Deposition Rate of NOy

dryoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
dryoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter

dryss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
dryss_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol

dtauc_tpt-al-hxy-ccl.description: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell

dtaus_tpt-al-hxy-scl.description: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

dxto_ti-u-hxy-u.description: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at t-points (points for tracers such as temperature, salinity, etc.). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dxto_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Cell Length in the X Direction at t-points

dxuo_ti-u-hxy-u.description: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dxuo_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Cell Length in the X Direction at u-points

dxvo_ti-u-hxy-u.description: The linear extent of the cell in the x direction of the horizontal grid centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dxvo_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Cell Length in the X Direction at v-points

dyto_ti-u-hxy-u.description: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at t-points (points for tracers such as temperature, salinity, etc.). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dyto_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Cell Length in the Y Direction at t-points

dyuo_ti-u-hxy-u.description: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at u-points (points for velocity in the x-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dyuo_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Cell Length in the Y Direction at u-points

dyvo_ti-u-hxy-u.description: The linear extent of the cell in the y direction of the horizontal grid centered at v-points (points for velocity in the y-direction). Not applicable to unstructured grids.
dyvo_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Cell Length in the Y Direction at v-points

e90inst_tpt-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction of an artificial tracer with a 90-day lifetime (e90)

edt_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

edt_tpt-al-hxys-u.description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for temperature due to parametrised eddies

emiach4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Anthropogenic emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

emiaco_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic CO

emianox_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
emianox_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx

emiaoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic Organic Aerosol

emiavnox_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Emission rate of NOx from aircraft
emiavnox_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Emission rate of NOx from aviation

emibbbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of black carbon aerosol into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass from all biomass burning

emibbch4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbch4_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission of CH4 from all biomass burning

emibbco_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of carbon monoxide (CO) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbco_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission rate of CO from all biomass burning

emibbdms_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of dimethyl sulfide (DMS) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbdms_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission of DMS from all biomass burning

emibbnh3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of ammonia (NH3) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbnh3_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission rate of NH3 from all biomass burning

emibbnox_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of nitrogen oxides (NOx) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbnox_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission rate of NOx from all biomass burning

emibboa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of particulate organic matter (organic aerosol) into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibboa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission of organic aerosol from all biomass burning

emibbso2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of SO2 into the atmosphere from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic).
emibbso2_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission rate of SO2 from all biomass burning

emibbvoc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of non-methane volatile organic compounds (NMVOCs) from all biomass burning (natural and anthropogenic)
emibbvoc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: total emission rate of NMVOC from all biomass burning

emibc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.
emibc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass

emibvoc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.\_If\_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.
emibvoc_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Total Emission Rate of Biogenic NMVOC

emic2h4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Total emission rate of ethene (C2H4) into the atmosphere

emic2h5oh_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the total emission rate of ethanol (C2H5OH) into the atmosphere

emic2h6_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the total emission rate of ethane (C2H6) into the atmosphere

emic3h6_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is the total emission rate of propene (C3H6) into the atmosphere

hfgeoubed_tavg-u-hxy-gis.description: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
hfgeoubed_tavg-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice

hfibthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
hfibthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
hfibthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics

hflsLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
hflsLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
hfls_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  All such heat fluxes are computed based on Celsius scale.
hfrainds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Heat flux associated with liquid water which drains from land. It is calculated relative to the heat that would be transported by runoff water entering the sea at zero degrees Celsius.
hfrunoffds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Temperature Flux Due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water

hfsnthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.
hfsnthermds_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics

hfssLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
hfssLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.ui-label: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Hourly surface upward sensible heat flux

hfss_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hfx_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale

hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean heat x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
hfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat X Transport

hfy_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean heat y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale. Report on native horizontal grid.
hfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Heat Y Transport

hno3_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

hno3_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

ho2_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.

htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
htovgyre_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Gyre

htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.description: From all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
htovovrt_tavg-u-hys-sea.ui-label: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Overturning

hur_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tavg-p19-hxy-air.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tavg-p19-hxy-u.description: This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hur_tpt-500hPa-hxy-air.description: Relative humidity at 500 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous

jpdftaureliqmodis_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid

laiLut_tavg-u-hxy-multi.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category

lat_ti-u-hxys-u.description: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree\_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

libmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-fis.description: quantity averaged over floating ice shelf

libmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet

licalvf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

lifmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: Total mass balance at the ice front (or vertical margin). It includes both iceberg calving and melt on vertical ice front
lifmassbf_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Land Ice Vertical Front Mass Balance Flux

limfecalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfediaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfemisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limfepico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

limirrcalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrdiaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limirrpico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

limncalc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiat_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limndiaz_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnmisc_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnpico_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

limnsw_tavg-u-hm-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Mass That Does not Displace Sea Water

litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-fis.description: quantity averaged over floating land ice
litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-fis.ui-label: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf

litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-gis.description: quantity averaged over grounded land ice
litempbot_tavg-u-hxy-gis.ui-label: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet

litemptop_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

lithk_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: This is needed in case ice sheet thickness changes in time

lithk_ti-u-hxy-is.description: The thickness of the ice sheet

lithk_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This variable identifies the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

loadbc_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

loaddust_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

loadnh4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

loadno3_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere\_primary\_organic\_content and atmosphere\_secondary\_organic\_content (see next two table entries).
loadoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter

loadpoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.
loadpoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter

loadso4_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadsoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.
loadsoa_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter

loadss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

lon_ti-u-hxys-u.description: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree\_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

lossco_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Carbon Monoxide

lossn2o_tavg-al-hxy-u.ui-label: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide

lwp_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: The total mass of liquid water in cloud per unit area.

lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: where land over land: this is computed as the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.
lwsnl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer

masscello_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times grid celll volume.

masscello_ti-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.

masso_tavg-u-hm-sea.description: Total mass of liquid sea water. For Boussinesq models, report this diagnostic as Boussinesq reference density times total volume.

mc_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mc_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the updrafts).

mcd_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

mcu_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

meanage_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

meanage_tavg-p39-hy-air.description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

mfo_tavg-u-ht-sea.description: Transport across\_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffies et al, 2016 (<https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-3231-2016>). Formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.

mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotst_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mlotstmin_tmin-u-hxy-sea.description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface. Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3 wrt to model level closest to 10 m depth.
mlotstmin_tmin-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T

mmraerh2o_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface aerosol waterMass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours
mmraerh2o_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.ui-label: Instantaneous surface aerosol water mass mixing ratio at CF sites

mmrbc_tavg-al-hxy-u.description: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.

mmrbc_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean elemental carbon mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrbc_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface elemental carbon Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

mmrnh4_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean NH4 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

mmrnh4_tpt-h2m-hxys-u.description: This variable represents the instantaneous surface NH4 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio at CF sites, sampled every 3 hours

mmrno3_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Daily mean NO3 aerosol mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer

no2_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
no2_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: NO2 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

o3_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.
o3_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

o3_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.description: maximum near-surface ozone  (add cell\_methods attribute "time: maximum")
o3_tmax-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: Daily Maximum O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

rlu4co2_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Upwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlu_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

rlu_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: Upwelling longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs4co2_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlucs_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

rlucs_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation  (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

rlus_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
rlus_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation

rlus_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

rluscsaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Flux corresponding to rluscs resulting from an aerosol-free call to radiation
rluscsaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation

rlut4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

rlut_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlut_tclmdc-u-hxy-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlut_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlut_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: at the top of the atmosphere (to be compared with satellite measurements)

rlutaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Flux corresponding to rlut resulting fom aerosol-free call to radiation

rlutch4ref_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA outgoing longwave flux assuming reference methane field

rlutcsaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Longwave Radiation

rsdcs_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

rsdcs_tpt-alh-hxys-u.description: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

rsdoabsorb_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from penetrative shortwave radiation within a grid cell.
rsdoabsorb_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ifs.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell not covered by sea ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-si.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-sn.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow but not by ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-sn.ui-label: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Hourly downward solar radiation flux at the surface

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.ui-label: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow

rsds_tpt-u-hxy-u.description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsds_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

rsdscs_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

rsdsdiff_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

rss_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

rsu_tavg-alh-hxy-u.description: Includes also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

rsus_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

rsut4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold
rsut4co2_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere

rsutcs_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

rsutcsaf_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation

rtmt_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
rtmt_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

rtmt_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: i.e., at the top of that portion of the atmosphere where dynamics are explicitly treated by the model. This is reported only if it differs from the net downward radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere.
rtmt_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Net Downward Radiative Flux at Top of Model

rv850_tavg-850hPa-hxy-air.description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

rv850_tpt-850hPa-hxy-air.description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-is.ui-label: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Computed as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0.
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: surface upward flux of water vapor due to sublimation of surface snow and ice
sbl_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass from the surface resulting from their conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.
sbl_tpt-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux

sci_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
sci_tavg-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs

sci_tavg-u-hxys-u.description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.
sci_tavg-u-hxys-u.ui-label: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs

scint_tavg-op4-hxy-sea.description: This is a fundamental aspect of the changes in the hydrological cycle and their impact on the oceans, and due to new numerical schemes and vertical discretizations, it is important to calculate it consistently with the model formulation.
scint_tavg-op4-hxy-sea.ui-label: Integral wrt depth of seawater practical salinity expressed as salt mass content

scldncl_tavg-u-hxy-scl.description: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
scldncl_tavg-u-hxy-scl.ui-label: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops

sduo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The eastward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between theaverageLagrangianflow velocityof a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocityof thefluidat a fixed position.

sdvo_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: The northward component of the net drift velocity of ocean water caused by surface wind-sea waves. The Stokes drift velocity could be defined as the difference between theaverageLagrangianflow velocityof a fluid parcel, and the average Eulerian flow velocityof thefluidat a fixed position.

sf6_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.
sf6_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.ui-label: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water

sfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.description: Depth-integrated total salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes across different lines on the Earth's surface (based on appendix J and table J1 of Griffieset al., 2016). Formally, this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the heat transport. Positive and negative numbers refer to total northward/eastward and southward/westward transports, respectively. The transport should be evaluated for the full depth of the ocean, except for the Pacific Equatorial Undercurrent, which is averaged from the surface to 350m.
sfacrossline_tavg-u-ht-sea.ui-label: Ocean Salt Mass Transport across Lines

sfcWind_tavg-h10m-hxy-u.description: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

sfcWind_tmax-h10m-hxy-u.description: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

sfcWind_tpt-h10m-hxys-u.description: This is the mean of the speed, not the speed computed from the mean u and v components of wind

sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
sfdsi_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux

sfpm10_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Hourly PM10 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

sfpm1_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Hourly PM1.0 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

sfpm25_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.description: Mass fraction of atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers. To specify the relative humidity and temperature at which the particle size applies, provide scalar coordinate variables with the standard names of "relative\_humidity" and "air\_temperature".
sfpm25_tavg-h2m-hxy-u.ui-label: PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer

sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.
sfriver_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers

sftflf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by floating ice shelf, the component of the ice sheet that is flowing over sea water

sftflf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land\_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

sftgif_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time

sftgif_ti-u-hxy-u.description: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).

sftgrf_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by grounded ice sheet

sftgrf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This is needed to distinguish between grounded glaciated ice (grounded = ice sheet and glacier) and ice shelves (floating over sea water), since land\_ice is by definition ice sheet, glacier and ice shelves

sftlaf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: Fraction of horizontal land grid cell area occupied by lake.
sftlaf_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Fraction of the Grid Cell Occupied by Lake

sftlf_ti-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.
sftlf_ti-u-hxy-u.ui-label: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)

sftof_ti-u-hxy-u.description: This is the area fraction at the ocean surface.

sfx_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.

sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean salt mass x transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'x-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
sfx_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass X Transport

sfy_tavg-ol-hxy-sea.description: Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.

sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.description: Ocean salt mass y transport vertically integrated over the whole ocean depth. Contains all contributions to 'y-ward' salt mass transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Report on native horizontal grid.
sfy_tavg-u-hxy-sea.ui-label: Vertically Integrated Ocean Salt Mass Y Transport

shrubFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.
